gen

Class SecondStageProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • gen.SecondStageProcessor

  • public class SecondStageProcessor
extends Object
    This class implements the transition system for the second stage defined in the thesis; i.e., it handles all transitions but MERGE, SWAP, DELETE and KEEP.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SecondStageProcessor

        public SecondStageProcessor(RealizeMaxentModel realizationMaxentModel,
                            ArgInsertionMaxentModel argInsertionMaxEnt,
                            OtherInsertionMaxentModel othersInsertionMaxEnt,
                            ChildInsertionMaxentModel childInsertionMaxEnt,
                            DenomMaxentModel denomMaxentModel,
                            DefaultRealizer defaultRealizer,
                            PositionHelper positionHelper,
                            edu.berkeley.nlp.lm.ArrayEncodedNgramLanguageModel<String> languageModel)
                     throws IOException
        Creates a new processor for the second stage of the generation process.
        Parameters:
        realizationMaxentModel - the maximum entropy model to use for REALIZE transitions
        argInsertionMaxEnt - the maximum entropy model to use for INSERT_BETWEEN transitions when the edge label matches :ARG[0-9]+
        othersInsertionMaxEnt - the maximum entropy model to use for INSERT_BETWEEN transitions when the edge label does not match :ARG[0-9]+
        childInsertionMaxEnt - the maximum entrpoy model to use for INSERT_CHILD transitions
        denomMaxentModel - the maximum entropy model to use for denominators
        positionHelper - the position helper to be used for computing the best REORDER transitions
        languageModel - the language model to be used by the score function
        Throws:
        IOException

    • Method Detail

      • getBestRealizationAsString

        public String getBestRealizationAsString(Amr amr)
        Computes the best realization of an AMR graph. As a side effect, the best found partial transition function is stored in the AMR graph's Amr.partialTransitionFunction variable. Note that the so-computed String is not post-processed, but post-processing can be done afterwards using the Amr.partialTransitionFunction of the AMR graph.
        Parameters:
        amr - the AMR graph
        Returns:
        the generated sentence

      • getBestRealizations

        public PrunedList getBestRealizations(Amr amr,
                                      Vertex v,
                                      Map<String,Prediction> syntacticAnnotation)
        Given a vertex v that has been assigned some POS tag and a syntactic annotation, this function computes the n-best REALIZE transitions where the parameter n is defined by maxNrOfPosRealizationPredictions.
        Parameters:
        amr - the AMR graph
        v - the vertex
        syntacticAnnotation - the syntactic annotation of the vertex
        Returns:
        the n-best REALIZE transitions
